gameplay
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  gameplay.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Overview

In the game, the class Player stores information about each player registered on the server.

Responsibilities

The class Player is responsible to store information about the player. A Player class stores information about:

  • The player's username;
  • The player's password;
  • The player's current dinosaur species;
  • The player's current status in the server;
A player can be created only by the PlayerManager class, so its constructor is never used programmatically. To create a dinosaur you have to call the PlayerManager#addPlayer(String, String) method of the PlayerManager class.

Collaborators

A player is managed by the PlayerManager class.

Version:
1.6
Author:
RAA
See Also:
PlayerManager, Serialized Form

setUsername

private void setUsername(java.lang.String theUsername)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The method setUsername sets the player username.
The user name is a non-null and not-empty string used to identify the player and log the player in.

Parameters:
theUsername - is the new username of the player
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if theUsername is empty or null

deleteCurrentSpecies

public void deleteCurrentSpecies()
The method deleteCurrentSpecies deletes the current dinosaur species associated to the player.

createCurrentSpecies

public Species createCurrentSpecies(SpeciesFactory theSpeciesFactory,
                                    java.lang.String theName)
                             throws exceptions.SpeciesAlreadyCreatedException,
                                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                    exceptions.NameAlreadyTakenException
The method createCurrentSpecies creates a new dinosaur species for the current player if the player didn't have one.
In order to create the species, it must be given one SpeciesFactory and the name of the species.

Parameters:
theSpeciesFactory - is the factory that will create the species.
theName - is the name of the new species
Returns:
the new species created
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - is thrown if the player already has one species
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if theName is a null or empty string
exceptions.SpeciesAlreadyCreatedException
exceptions.NameAlreadyTakenException

getCurrentSpecies

public Species getCurrentSpecies()
The method getCurrentSpecies returns the current dinosaur species associated to the player.

Returns:
a reference to the current player species
